intro: Gratiola salmantica, commonly known as Salamanca betony, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Gratiola salmantica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
